meanings.definition: Supporting or advocating for the family unit.
meanings.sent1: The profamily community organized a picnic for all families in the neighborhood.
meanings.sent2: She always makes profamily decisions that benefit her loved ones.
meanings.sent3: The profamily group dressed up as a giant family tree for Halloween.
meanings.sent4: His profamily actions spoke louder than any words.
meanings.sent5: The profamily message was clear: family comes first.

meanings.definition: In favor of traditional family values.
meanings.sent1: The profamily politician emphasized the importance of traditional values in society.
meanings.sent2: Their profamily beliefs were deeply rooted in tradition.
meanings.sent3: The profamily grandmother passed down her cherished family recipes.
meanings.sent4: The profamily heritage was evident in every aspect of their lives.
meanings.sent5: They celebrated every holiday with profamily customs and rituals.

meanings.sent1: The profamily organization provided resources for families in need.
meanings.sent2: She dedicated her life to profamily initiatives that improved family health.
meanings.sent3: The profamily event offered free health screenings for all family members.
meanings.sent4: Their profamily campaign raised awareness about mental health in families.
meanings.sent5: The profamily program aimed to strengthen family bonds through shared activities.
